name: id
shortDescription: print real and effective user and group IDs
longDescription: Print user and group information for the specified USER, or (when USER omitted) for the current user.

options.name: context
options.description: Print only the security context of the process, which is generally the user’s security context inherited from the parent process.  If neither SELinux or SMACK is enabled then print a warning and set the exit status to 1.

options.name: groups
options.description: Print only the group ID and the supplementary groups.

options.name: name
options.description: Print the user or group name instead of the ID number.  Requires ‘-u’, ‘-g’, or ‘-G’.

options.name: real
options.description: Print the real, instead of effective, user or group ID.  Requires ‘-u’, ‘-g’, or ‘-G’.

options.name: zero
options.description: Delimit output items with NUL characters.  This option is not permitted when using the default format.
